recipe_card: Spicy Beef Filet in Oyster Sauce 11 Ratings
recipe_name: Spicy Beef Filet in Oyster Sauce
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon oyster sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ pound beef tenderloin, cut into 1/4 inch strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons oyster sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  onion, thinly sliced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Stir together 1 teaspoon vegetable oil, 1 teaspoon oyster sauce, and 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch in a bowl. Add beef and toss to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator 30 to 45 minutes. Remove from the refrigerator 10 minutes before cooking."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir together water, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, 2 tablespoons oyster sauce, and pepper in a small bowl; set aside. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Stir in onion, and cook until it beings to brown on the edges, about 1 minute. Add the beef, and continue cooking and stirring until the beef is just slightly pink, about 5 minutes. Pour in the sauce; cook and stir until the sauce has thickened and turned translucent, about 1 minute more."}]

recipe_card: Fun Karnal (Beef and Broccoli) 14 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2  1 1/2-inch-thick New York strip steaks, cut into 1-inch pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons dried minced onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups white rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup canned sliced bamboo shoots, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup canned sliced mushrooms, drained (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chopped green onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  green bell pepper, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon red pepper flakes (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons soy sauce (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup broccoli florets"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup sugar snap peas (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ (10 fluid ounce) bottle oyster sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chopped green onion"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place steak in a bowl; top with minced onion, garlic, and 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Stir to coat."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring rice and 4 cups water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir bamboo shoots, mushrooms, 1/4 cup green onion, green bell pepper, red pepper flakes, and 3 tablespoons soy sauce in the hot oil until green bell pepper is slightly tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Add steak, broccoli, and sugar snap peas; cook until beef is browned and no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk cornstarch and 2 tablespoons water together in a bowl until cornstarch is dissolved. Heat oyster sauce in a saucepan over medium-low heat; slowly stir in cornstarch mixture until sauce is thickened, 3 to 5 minutes. Stir oyster sauce mixture into steak mixture; sprinkle with 1/4 cup green onions. Cook steak mixture until sauce is thickened, 7 to 8 minutes. Serve over rice."}]

recipe_card: Mongolian Beef II 142 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 pounds boneless sirloin tip roast"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons dry sherry"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons crushed red pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  whole dried red chile peppers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅜ cup vegetable oil, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 bunches green onions, cut into 2 inch pieces"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Partially freeze the roast for easier slicing. Slice the roast into 3x1/2 inch strips, and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl, combine well the soy sauce, sherry, sesame oil, cornstarch, brown sugar, crushed red pepper and whole chile peppers. Place beef in the mixture and coat well. Cover and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet or wok over medium high heat. Place green onions in the hot oil. Cover, reduce heat to low and cook 6 minutes, or until tender. Remove green onions and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In the same skillet or wok, heat remaining 1/4 cup of oil over medium high heat. Add beef mixture and saute for 5 minutes, or until the beef is thoroughly cooked. Return green onions to the pan and saute for 30 seconds more, or until heated through."}]

recipe_card: Beef and Riced Broccoli Bowl 3 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup beef broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup hoisin sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons sesame oil, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon oyster sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ pounds New York strip steak, thinly sliced into bite-sized pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (10 ounce) bags frozen broccoli rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds, or to taste (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste (Optional)"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together beef broth, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, 1 tablespoon sesame oil, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and brown sugar in a bowl until cornstarch and sugar are dissolved."},{"recipe_directions":"Place sliced steak in a separate bowl and drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon of sesame oil. Stir until evenly coated."},{"recipe_directions":"Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add broccoli rice, garlic, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes; stirring occasionally. Divide broccoli rice into serving bowls."},{"recipe_directions":"Add beef to the skillet. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring continually, for 5 minutes. Pour sauce over beef and cook for 5 more minutes or until sauce has thickened."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon beef over broccoli rice. Garnish with sesame seeds and crushed red pepper."}]

recipe_card: Jamey's Restaurant Style Beef and Broccoli 48 Ratings
recipe_name: Jamey's Restaurant Style Beef and Broccoli
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup dry sherry"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup oyster sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons Asian (toasted) sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ pounds beef sirloin steak, trimmed and cut into 1/8-inch-thick slices"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons vegetable oil, plus more if needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  thin slice fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound broccoli, cut into florets"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (16 ounce) can sliced mushrooms, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8 ounces snow peas"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Whisk sherry, oyster sauce, sesame oil, soy sauce, sugar, and cornstarch together in a bowl until sugar dissolves."},{"recipe_directions":"Arrange steak slices in a shallow bowl, pour the oyster sauce mixture over the meat, stir to coat, and refrigerate at least 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ginger and garlic in hot oil until fragrant about 1 minute. Remove and discard the ginger and garlic. Stir broccoli, mushrooms, and snow peas together in the skillet; cook and stir in the hot oil until the broccoli is bright green and almost tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove the vegetable mixture to a bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour beef slices with the marinade into the skillet; cook and stir until the sauce forms a glaze on the beef and the meat is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Return the cooked vegetables to the wok; cook and stir until the broccoli is heated through, about 3 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Spicy Orange Zest Beef 126 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound beef tenderloin, cut into 1/2 inch strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup orange juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup seasoned rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon hot chile paste (such as sambal oelek)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon brown sugar, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"cooking spray"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons grated orange zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch green onions, sliced - white parts and tops separated"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine beef, orange juice, rice vinegar, soy sauce, hot chili paste, brown sugar, and garlic in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Strain beef in a colander set over a large bowl, allowing beef to drain thoroughly, about 5 minutes. Reserve marinade."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir water and cornstarch into the bowl of marinade. Whisk until cornstarch is dissolved, set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Spray skillet with cooking spray and place over high heat. Cook beef for 1 minute without stirring; cook and stir for an additional minute."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir in light parts of green onion and orange zest; cook for 30 seconds."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir in marinade and green onion tops; cook and stir until beef is no longer pink inside and sauce is reduced and thick, about 2 to 3 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Season with salt and black pepper to taste."}]

recipe_card: Hot and Tangy Broccoli Beef 152 Ratings

Peel stalks; cut diagonally into thin slices."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine 1 cup water, remaining 2 Tbsp. soy sauce, 4 teaspoons cornstarch and crushed red pepper in small bowl. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in hot wok or large skillet over high heat. Add beef and stir-fry 1 minute; remove."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat remaining 2 Tbsp. oil in same pan. Add broccoli and onion; stir-fry 2 minutes. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp. water over vegetables; cover and cook 2 minutes, stirring occasionally."},{"recipe_directions":"Add beef and soy sauce mixture; cook and stir until sauce boils and thickens. Remove from heat; stir in vinegar."}]

recipe_card: Szechuan Spicy Eggplant 186 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Remove eggplant stem and cut flesh into 1-inch cubes. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix together soy sauce, stock, oyster sauce, chili sauce, sugar, and black pepper in a medium bowl until well combined; set aside. Stir together water and cornstarch in a small bowl until smooth; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Coat a large, deep pan with cooking spray over high heat and heat until very hot, about 3 minutes. Cook and stir 1/2 of the green onions, ginger, and garlic in the hot pan until lightly browned, 3 to 5 minutes. Add beef; cook and stir until lightly browned and crumbly, about 3 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir in eggplant, then pour soy sauce mixture over all. Cover the pan, reduce heat to medium low, and let simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add shrimp during the last few minutes of cooking."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir in cornstarch mixture and cook until thickened. Mix in remaining green onions and sesame oil. Serve over hot rice."}]

Beefy Chinese Dumplings 96 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ pounds ground beef"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups shredded Chinese cabbage"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 medium carrot, shredded"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 medium onion, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (14 ounce) package wonton wrappers"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Mix together beef, cabbage, carrot, and onion in a large bowl. Stir in egg, soy sauce, oil, sugar, and salt."},{"recipe_directions":"Place 1 heaping teaspoon filling in the center of a wonton wrapper. Moisten wonton edges with a few drops water. Fold dumpling in half and pinch the edges together to seal. Create a ripple pattern along the sealed edge by pinching and gently pushing together small segments. Repeat to make remaining dumplings."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add dumplings and cook until they float to the surface, about 5 minutes. Drain."}]

recipe_card: Orange Peel Beef 56 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Combine beef, 1 tablespoon of soy sauce, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, and baking soda in a bowl and mix thoroughly. Cover and refrigerate, 1 to 3 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat peanut oil in a wok or large, nonstick skillet over high heat. Stir in garlic, ginger, orange zest, and red pepper flakes, and cook until garlic begins to brown, 20 to 30 seconds. Add beef; cook and stir until beef begins to brown and crisp, about 5 minutes. Whisk together 1 tablespoon soy sauce, orange juice concentrate, rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, brown sugar, and 1 teaspoon cornstarch in a small bowl. Stir into beef, and cook until sauce has thickened and turned clear, about 30 seconds."}]

Stir in beef strips. Let stand for at least 10 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"In a separate small bowl, mix together water, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch, sugar, sesame seeds, and red pepper flakes; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok or skillet over high heat. Cook and stir beef in hot oil for 1 minute; remove, and set aside. Heat remaining tablespoon of oil in the same pan. Saute carrots and white part of green onions for 2 minutes. recipe_card: Asian Fire Meat 281 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cloves garlic, crushed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large red onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"ground black pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon red pepper flakes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons sesame seeds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2  leeks, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 small carrot, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound beef round steak, sliced paper thin"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, garlic, and red onion. Stir in the black pepper, red pepper flakes, sesame seeds, leeks and carrot. Mix in the meat by hand to ensure even coating. Cover and let marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Brush the bottom half of a wok with cooking oil, and heat over medium-high heat. Put in all of the meat and marinade at once, and cook stirring constantly. The meat will be cooked after just a few minutes. Remove from heat and serve with rice or noodles. For Korean-style fire meat, roll the meat mixture up in a leaf of red lettuce."}]

recipe_card: Potstickers (Chinese Dumplings) 96 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound raw shrimp, peeled and deveined"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 pounds ground beef"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  shallot, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 bunch green onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 leaves napa cabbage, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon Asian (toasted) sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and white pepper to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (10 ounce) package round gyoza/potsticker wrappers"},{"recipe_ingredients":"vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup water"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place the shrimp in the work bowl of a food processor, and process until the shrimp are finely ground. Set aside in a large bowl. Working in batches, process the ground beef to a fine grind, and set aside with the shrimp. Combine the shrimp and ground beef with ginger, shallot, green onions, napa cabbage, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt and pepper, and white sugar, and mix the ingredients until thoroughly combined."},{"recipe_directions":"To fill the pot stickers, place a wrapper on a work surface in front of you, and place a scant teaspoon of filling in the center. With a wet finger, dampen the edges of the wrapper. Fold the dough into a half-moon shape, enclosing the filling, and press and seal to remove extra air and tightly seal the edges together. It's nice to fold several small pleats in the top half of the wrapper for a traditional look before you seal in the filling. Refrigerate the filled wrappers on a parchment-lined baking sheet while you finish filling and sealing the pot stickers."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet with a lid over medium heat. Place pot stickers into the hot oil, flat sides down, without crowding, and let fry until the bottoms are golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Turn the dumplings over, and pour the water over them. Cover the pan with a lid and let the dumplings steam until the water has nearly evaporated and the dumplings have begun to fry in oil again, 5 to 7 minutes. Uncover the skillet, and let the pot stickers cook until all the water is evaporated and the wrapper has shrunk down tightly onto the filling, another 2 to 3 minutes."}]

Add the snow peas and stir-fry for an additional 3 minutes. Add the soy sauce mixture, bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Lower heat and simmer until the sauce is thick and smooth. Serve immediately."}]

recipe_card: Bitter Melon and Black Bean Sauce Beef 7 Ratings
recipe_name: Bitter Melon and Black Bean Sauce Beef
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"ice cubes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  bitter melon, seeded and sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons soy sauce, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons cornstarch, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 ounces beef, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½  onion, sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon chopped fresh ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon black bean sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon oyster sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch white sugar, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Fill a bowl with ice; add enough salted water to make an ice bath. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook the bitter melon in the boiling water until tender yet firm, about 2 minutes; strain the melon. Place the melon into the ice bath; allow to sit until bitterness is extracted, about 1 hour. Drain melon."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk 1 teaspoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon cornstarch, and baking soda together in a bowl. Add beef and toss to evenly coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat wok, or a large skillet, on high until smoking. Add 1 tablespoon oil. Lay beef evenly across the bottom of the wok; cook until browned, about 2 minutes per side. Remove beef. Pour in 1 teaspoon of oil; allow to heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger; cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in bitter melon; cook until combined, about 1 minute."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir black bean sauce into melon mixture. Stir in remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar. Pour in 3/4 cup water; cover and let simmer until flavors combine, 2 to 3 minutes. Uncover and mix in remaining cornstarch and 1 teaspoon water and stir until thickened."}]

recipe_card: Spicy Crispy Beef 255 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ tablespoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12 ounces flank steak, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 quart oil for frying"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 tablespoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ tablespoon rice wine"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons honey"},{"recipe_ingredients":"7 tablespoons granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ tablespoon chile paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons chopped fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cloves garlic, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup sliced onion"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup diced red bell pepper"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, in a mixing bowl, combine cornstarch, salt and pepper together. Mix thoroughly. Toss the steak slices in the cornstarch mixture and coat well."},{"recipe_directions":"Deep fry the coated steak slices until golden brown. Check to make sure they are cooked through. Remove from oil, and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In another mixing bowl, combine the soy sauce, rice vinegar, rice wine and honey. Add sugar, chili paste, water, and ginger. Mix well and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat a wok or deep frying pan over medium high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of oil, and quickly saute the onion, garlic and red pepper for 30 seconds. Add the sauce mixture, and cook another 30 seconds. Finally, add the strips of fried steak and toss to heat through and coat with sauce."}]

recipe_card: Grilled Hoisin Beef 89 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (1 pound) beef skirt steak"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup hoisin sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons Chinese vinegar (or sherry vinegar)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons hot sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cloves garlic, finely minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon packed brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  green onion, light parts only, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"Toasted sesame seeds"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Whisk hoisin sauce, vinegar, soy sauce, hot sauce, sesame oil, grated ginger, garlic, brown sugar, salt, and pepper together in a large mixing bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut skirt steak crosswise into about 4 or 5 smaller pieces. Transfer steak into marinade and toss until all pieces are evenly coated. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate; marinate at least 2 hours and up to 12 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Line a baking pan with paper towels. Transfer pieces of steak to the paper towels and mop off some of the marinade."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer steak pieces to grill. Cook to medium rare or medium, 4 to 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read between 130 and 135 degrees F (about 54 degrees C). Thinner pieces might finish earlier. Transfer steak to a warm plate. Let rest for a few minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer steak to a warm serving platter and pour any accumulated juices over skirt steak. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and sliced green onions."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Gather ingredients."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat, and add oil. Stir in soy sauce."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Mix together cornstarch and water, and stir in. Season with pepper; add salt to taste. recipe_card: Slow Cooker Mongolian Beef 418 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place flank steak and cornstarch into a resealable plastic bag. Shake the bag to evenly coat the flank steak with the cornstarch. recipe_card: Beef with Vegetables 91 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"8 ounces beef filet, cut into 1/2 inch strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  onion, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon chopped fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  green bell pepper, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  carrot, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (10.5 ounce) can beef broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon oyster sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt and pepper to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef slices in the oil for 5 minutes, or until well browned. Add the onion, garlic and ginger and saute for 5 more minutes. Then add the green bell pepper, carrot and beef broth. Reduce heat to low and let simmer."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, in a separate small bowl, combine the corn flour, sugar, soy sauce and oyster sauce, if desired. Stir thoroughly, forming a smooth paste. Slowly add this to the simmering beef and vegetables, stirring well, and let simmer to desired thickness. Season with salt and pepper to taste."}]

recipe_card: Super-Simple, Super-Spicy Mongolian Beef 460 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon hoisin sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon red pepper flakes (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound beef flank steak, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon peanut oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large green onions, thinly sliced"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, sugar, garlic, and red pepper flakes in a large bowl. Toss beef with marinade; cover the bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour to overnight."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat peanut oil in a wok or large, nonstick skillet over high heat. Cook and stir green onions in hot oil for 5 to 10 seconds. Remove beef from marinade and add to green onions in the wok; discard marinade. Cook and stir until beef is no longer pink and begins to brown, about 5 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Szechuan Beef 176 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 clove garlic, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon crushed red pepper"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound sirloin steak, cut into bite-sized strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups fresh broccoli florets"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 small onions, cut into wedges"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup chicken broth"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup peanuts"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Stir together soy sauce, cornstarch, garlic, and crushed red pepper in a non-metal bowl. Add steak and toss to coat. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Stir-fry beef in hot oil until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Add broccoli, onions, and water chestnuts; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in broth and bring to a boil. Stir in peanuts; cook for 1 minute and serve hot."}]

recipe_card: Crispy Orange Beef 1,045 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ pounds beef top sirloin, thinly sliced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup long grain rice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup rice wine vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons frozen orange juice concentrate"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups oil for frying"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons grated fresh ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ tablespoons minced garlic"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons orange zest"},{"recipe_ingredients":"8  broccoli florets, lightly steamed or blanched"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Lay beef in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with paper towels. Allow to dry in the refrigerator for 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, bring water and rice to a boil in a medium saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender, about 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix together sugar, rice vinegar, orange juice concentrate, soy sauce, and salt in a small bowl. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Toss dried beef in cornstarch to coat. Fry coated beef in hot oil in small batches until crispy and golden brown; set aside. Drain oil from the wok, leaving about 1 tablespoon."},{"recipe_directions":"Add ginger, garlic, and orange zest to remaining oil in wok. Cook and stir briefly until fragrant. Pour in soy sauce mixture; bring to a boil and cook until thick and syrupy, about 5 minutes. Stir in fried beef and cook until heated through. Serve hot over steamed rice and garnish with broccoli."}]

recipe_card: Crispy Ginger Beef 133 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound flank steak, cut into thin strips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup canola oil, or as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large carrot, cut into matchstick-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  green bell pepper, cut into matchstick-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  red bell pepper, cut into matchstick-size pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  green onions, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup minced fresh ginger root"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  garlic cloves, minced"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup rice vinegar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons soy sauce"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sesame oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon red pepper flakes, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Place cornstarch in a large bowl; gradually whisk in water until smooth. Whisk eggs into cornstarch mixture; toss steak strips in mixture to coat."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour canola oil into a wok, 1-inch deep; heat oil over high heat until hot but not smoking. Place 1/4 of the beef strips into hot oil; separate strips with a fork. Cook, stirring frequently, until coating is crisp and golden, about 3 minutes. Remove beef to drain on paper towels; repeat with remaining beef."},{"recipe_directions":"Drain off all but 1 tablespoon oil; cook and stir carrot, bell peppers, green onions, ginger, and garlic over high heat until lightly browned but still crisp, about 3 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk sugar, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes together in a small bowl. Pour sauce mixture over vegetables in wok; bring mixture to a boil. Stir beef back into vegetable mixture; cook and stir just until heated through, about 3 minutes."}]
